title: High Insurance Premiums? Check Your Credit Score
summary: Your credit score has a big impact on whether you can get a mortgage and whether your credit-card application is accepted. But, surprisingly, it can also affect how much you pay for insurance.
tag-1: High Insurance Premiums? Check Your Credit Score
tag-2: Your credit score has a big impact on whether you can get a mortgage and whether your credit-card application is accepted. But, surprisingly, it can also affect how much you pay for insurance.
tag-3: Credit scores have the biggest influence on auto and home insurance rates, but some companies also use them to set premiums for life and disability policies. The way they see it, if you have a record of not paying bills or you appear to carry too much debt, you may not make your premium payments on time.
tag-4: Insurers use a combination of credit scores and insurance information to come up with an insurance score. For car insurance, your insurance score might encompass your credit history, your driving record and the type of car you drive. For your home, your insurance score might consider the age of your home, the type of construction, security devices and prior loss history. If an insurer feels carrying a hefty amount of debt might impact your health, it might even ask you to pay more for life insurance.
tag-5: Insurance companies are required to notify you if credit information leads to an adverse action, such as cancelling or denying coverage, reducing your coverage or raising your premiums. If you think your coverage or premiums have been affected by a credit report, ask your agent or an insurance-company representative for additional information.
tag-6: While you may not be able to get a precise insurance score from your carrier, you can at least get a handle on your credit history and credit score. By going to annualcreditreport.com, you can get a free copy every year of your credit report from each of the three major credit bureaus: Equifax, Experian and TransUnion. While at the site, you can also purchase a copy of your credit score from these firms.
